headline: Shrimp Scampi Bake
description: This baked shrimp scampi recipe features shrimp baked in butter, garlic, lemon juice, and parsley with a bit of Dijon mustard to kick up the flavor.

video.description: Dijon mustard adds zesty zip to shrimp scampi.
video.name: Shrimp Scampi Bake

name: Shrimp Scampi Bake
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds medium raw shrimp, shelled, deveined, with tails attached

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Arrange shrimp in a shallow baking dish.
Combine butter, Dijon, lemon juice, garlic, and parsley in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until butter melts. Pour over shrimp.
Bake in the preheated oven until shrimp are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 12 to 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Made this for a non-meat-eater guest and she went mad for it. So easy too. Well done.
My hubby and I really enjoyed this version of shrimp scampi. So fast and easy to make.
I keep this recipe under my go to favorites, easy quick meal.

Really Really good!! I halfed the recipe baked 6 min added panko and a splash of heavy cream continue for 8 more, toasted some Dave's epic bread buttered of course sliced into fingers for sauce. I can't tell you flavorful this is. lots of garlic is a plus

This is just incredible! I used frozen Langostinos instead of shrimp. I cut the butter down to 1/4 cup by adding approx 1/4 cup good quality EVOO instead. I served over pasta lightly sprinkled with olive oil, and sprinkled with grated cheese (Romano and Parmesan, but any Italian cheeses will do). I poured the sauce from the pan over the pasta, and served the Langostinos on top. It cooks quickly so make sure you prepare the pasta and grated cheese first. My family gobbled it up like it was their last meal!

This is a simple and tasty recipe. My only modification is I only had 1 lb of shrimp; so I pour the butter mixture over shrimp and Al dente angel hair pasta. The sauce is enough to cover it all so I use the complete amount recommended in recipe for sauce. Delicious!
Hands down the easiest, fastest and best way to make shrimp scampi .
This is delicious. Made it MANY times. For my husband and I, I cut the recoil in half. Any leftover I'll throw in a salad for lunch the next day.

This was really delicious! Easy to make, no fuss meal, fit for company. We enjoyed it very much. The second time I made this, I added asparagus spears, and a few thinly sliced mushrooms , and they did great in this already wonderful recipe. I just love to use what we have on hand when I cook. With a side salad and crusty bread, this recipe is a winner for a weeknight dinner.
Really easy and very tasty! Will be making this again and again!
Delicious. Didn’t change a thing and served over linguini

Very easy recipe with amazing results… added a little more butter 1/4 cup. Also added 1/2 cup of wine (Chardonnay) and cappers to taste… served over angel hair pasta with shavings of Parmigiano-Reggiano… this was a show stopper!
This is so simple and a great dish. Easy to add things and make it your own.
Absolutely the best recipe!
This was SO easy and it doesn't make a mess of my cooktop ! Hubby said it's a keeper!
It was absolutely great! My husband loved it too. I used only 1/2 cup butter and added a dash of onion powder. I also used frozen shrimp. It was so easy but soooooo good.

For the simplicity of this meal and the deliciousness, five stars! I did make the following modifications. I made this on the stove top as I was terrified to over cook the shrimp in the oven. I also added 1 teaspoon of crushed red pepper, a shake of wildetree rancher which is a seasoned pepper, and 2 tablespoons of white wine. I also sprinkled with fresh parmigiana cheese and used dry parsley as I didn’t have fresh. I am not sure how much garlic I added, because you measure garlic with your heart!!! Good recipe!
It was wonderful. I found jumbo shrimp only needed about 6 minutes. Very easy.
Nothing special. Prefer recipes without the dijon.

Truth be told I didn't really use precise measurements, I just kept tasting it till I was happy. I too used defrosted cooked shrimp so I didn't broil it for the full 15 minutes, it was more like 8 minutes. I did take the advice of a reviewer and sprinkled some panko on top and then used about 5 
 minutes under the broiler to crisp it up a bit. The shrimp came out just fine and I'm sure I'll be using this version of the scampi recipe again. Oh yeah, I only gave it 4 stars because I really don't like butter ...this was more for my husband.
Really good recipe, thank you! The shrimp was tender and full of flavor. The sauce was a little watery, probably needed to dry the shrimp first. Will definitely make this again and again!
One of my favorites!
very good
Wow! Very easy and delicious... I do admit, I don’t measure; but regardless it was easy and tasty! I used dried parsley Vs fresh.
I left the pasta out and just used it as a shrimp course for a more elaborate meal. It worked out great

I followed comment from reviewers to increase garlic & dried parsley. I added some Contadina diced tomatoes to the sauce and dash of cayenne pepper. I served over small amount of angel pasta. I think the diced tomatoes saved the dish because it would have been too bland otherwise.
Was SO easy and delicious! I used rice instead of pasta.
This is one of my go-to dishes! Made it a lot through the years. I pour it over fettuccine and it’s fabulous.

To quote my husband..."it's been a long time since I've had a pasta dish this good!" The only thing I added was 1 whole, minced shallots which I mixed in with the butter sauce. Btw, the mustard in the recipe is a game changer; do NOT omit! Who knew mustard would be good in a scampi dish! The VERY BEST recipe for scampi- ever! And soooo easy. Make this!
This was absolutely delicious! Made it as directed and was pleasantly surprised.
no changes

I've recently started cooking at home and looking for restaurant quality recipes. This recipe was easy and quick. My family loved the light and bright flavors. The lemon juice and Dijon mustard made it pop in my mouth. I'll definitely be making again, just lighter on the crushed peppers for my hubby.
I thought the flavors were a bit bland the first meal, but were fantastic the second and 3rd meal. The more time flavors had to mingle the better.

This recipe was delicious. I added garlic powder, onion powder, season salt, and red peppers to the shrimp before I threw them in the pan and put it in the oven. It has such great flavor and was definitely a hit with my family!
Outstanding. We love this recipe. Restaurant quality. Crazy easy too!
WOW. It was so good.
Great recipe easy and loved the flavor!
This was SO easy and SO delicious!
This was great! Love being able to put the shrimp in the oven and not worry about it. My family loves it!
just made this recipe sans mustard. it was delicious and simple to make. I used 1 and half cups of butter on the shrimp and a half a cup on some angel hair pasta. The family raved about it.
Delicious! I put it on rice. The second batch we tossed leftover broccoli in with rice. This is a keeper. Will make again.
Very delicious and simple!

This was a big hit for dinner. Instead of pasta I put the shrimp over spinach. I incorporated some ingredients from the other reviews such as, less mustard, added some old bay seasoning (just a few sprinkles into the butter sauce), added the bread crumbs before putting the shrimp in the oven and shredded parmesan cheese 3 mins before taking the dish out of the oven. Super delicious!

Used horseradish mustard; added a layer of panKo on shrimp while cooking; served over a layers of five color pasta, then sautéed spinach with garlic, and shredded Parmigiana next, then the baked shrimp. Delicious!

I love this easy, simple recipe! My extremely picky boys (8 & 45) also love it. I probably make it every other week, just as stated. Today I used lime also & some lime-infused olive oil. Poured the extra sauce over my rice pilaf. SO GOOD!
I will make again, the best.
Easy. Delicious. A real winner!

I haven't had shrimp scampi before but if this is what it tastes like, I love it. I ate it over some angel haired pasta which paired very well. Also, the suggested amount of butter in my opinion is perfect; any less would not have provided me as much sauce as I would have liked. 

I feel bad for not trying the base recipe as is, but the alterations I made did work out really well. I halved the recipe because I was using only 1 lb shrimp, and made the following alterations:

+3/8 cup dry white wine (sauvignon blanc), 
1/2 ish tsp each black pepper/ajinomoto (msg salt)/regular salt, 1 sprig dried rosemary, couple pieces of bay leaves.

I will 100% make again, thank you for introducing me to this tasty and easy meal.

Made it as per directions. But next time I will only use 1 stick of butter. Baked it on top of par cooked cheese tortellini, used the extra butter to butter Italian bread crumbs as a topper. We enjoyed it and will definitely make again. The Grey Poupon added just the right touch, Thanks!
Really tasty and easy to make.

This was so easy and delicious! I followed the recipe ingredients and measurements as written but had to sub dried parsley for fresh. We loved the sauce! After reading other reviews I cut the oven time to 9 minutes which was perfect. I served this over whole wheat angel hair with fresh green beans (COVID creativity) and will definitely make it again!
I really did not like this recipe nor did my son. It had very little taste and I won’t be making it again.

I am not a cook. Everything I make comes out terrible. I made this for my husband‘a birthday. And he loved it! It was delicious if I say so myself! Only change was adding white wine and only cooking the shrimp for about 8-9 minutes.

Made this tonight and served over angel-hair spaghetti and asparagus. The whole thing took very little time and apart from halving the butter and mustard I made no changes. Everyone in my family loved it and ate it up. While I thought it was very good as well, I would like to find a way for the sauce to not separate. I would also suggest to anyone wanting to try this that they keep an eye on the baking time! I am very glad I did--contrary to instructions the shrimp were done in 6 minutes! Still, this was excellent and I will definitely make it again.

I’ve made this dish many times and I do everything on the stove first with the butter the Dijon the lemon juice and I add white wine and parsley. After the mixture cools I lay down the shrimp and pop it in a 450° oven for 12 minutes. 15 minutes if you do 2 pounds but I did 1 pound and used one stick of butter. I still however used a whole lemon quarter cup of wine and a tablespoon
I made it exactly as the recipe calls for and it was delicious. Will definitely make it again.

Delicious and who knew you could bake shrimp scampi!?!? Luckily my boyfriend was my sous chef because I didn’t know to add the boiled pasta to the shrimp before putting it in the oven, the recipe assumed that one should know :) We added some pesto, diced tomatoes and mozzarella....super yumm!

This is genius. Followed some of the comments. Would say use less butter, up the lemon, white wine is a nice touch. But if you fix this according to the recipe you’ll be fine. Use parchment or foil to line the pan...easy cleanup.

Love this dish!! It is so easy and such a crowd pleaser! From family dinners to an easy elegant dish for a dinner party- what’s not to like? This has become my “I don’t want to cook tonite I’ll throw together something easy” and I look like a rockstar! So easy, it’s the first thing my 16y old son learned to cook- he would make it for his girlfriends family and blow them away. He’s in the military now and still makes it when he and his buddies get together.

I have made it twice in a week, once for just hubby and I, then for the rest of my family. I did not have fresh shrimp, so I used frozen with tails, and also used dried parsley. This was incredible in both taste and ease. 
For those having an issue with "too much sauce", that is a true oxymoron. Use any leftover sauce over chicken, rice, potatoes, pasta, whatever. Dip your bread or biscuits in it to flavor them! My entire family loves garlic, so I am never shy about adding it to anything. This was awesome!

My pet peeve is tail-on shrimp in sauce, especially butter sauce. I was fortunate enough to purchase two pounds of raw 21-30 shrimp that had been thoroughly cleaned, shelled and de-tailed. I made the recipe as written, adding red pepper flakes (traditional) and extra garlic to suit our taste buds. LOVE the addition of Dijon in this recipe, as it binds with the fat to make an actual sauce. Cook time for the jumbo shrimp was 15 minutes. Served on a platter of linguine and garnished with parm curls and more fresh parsley, this was a fabulous meal. My family requested (and received) homemade “Red Lobster biscuits” which I thought were overkill...but a fresh, crusty baguette and roasted asparagus would have been the perfect accompaniments. This recipe has forever changed the way I make scampi!
I used 1/2 the amount of butter and reduced the total recipe since it was just family. So delicious over fettucini.

The flavor was great. I did reduce the amount of the sauce and added a splash of white wine based on other reviews as well as the amount of mustard so as not to overwhelm. (Used just a half tsp or so.) Very good!

This recipe was just what I was looking for. I cook for 2, so If I make something that makes 6, I can have some the next day. This scampi was wonderful the next day. Better than before. The seasoning had time to mix with the other flavors. It was also quick!!!
So easy! I added a tablespoon of Old Bay to the butter mixture, and poured the extra butter over linguine (with 1/2 cup of salted pasta water) after baking with the shrimp. Delicious!

Only had frozen shrimp. Neither of us liked it much. I put crushed crackers on top 
Probably will try another recipe next time

WOW! Amazing flavor and so easy. Followed most of the reviews and cut the butter in half, added the wine, left out the mustard, but added salt, pepper, and thyme. Only cooked for 7 minutes due to having only a half pound of smaller shrimp. Will definitely be making this again, thanks for the great recipe!
Very easy and delicious!!
Delish. I didn’t have Dijon so I used a tablespoon of brown mustard and a splash (or two) of Chardonnay. Even the picky kids liked it. Happy New Year!
Very good. I used less mustard otherwise followed the recipe
Super simple. 1.5-2x the spices. Added 1/2 tsp salt, pepper and Chili powder to give it some bite.
Followed all the instructions/ingredient list. Agree with other reviewers that a splash of white wine is a nice addition. Served over penne noodles and was awesome!

This is a great recipe. It is quick and easy. I have made this recipe multiple times. I double all the sauce ingredients and add some white wine and fresh ground pepper. The reason I double the sauce is because I serve the scampi over fettuccine
Make exactly as it says. Perfect!
Absolutely delicious and super easy! I followed the recipe exactly. I love sauce and would rather have too much than not enough. Now I know you can cut the butter in half and have plenty.

This was amazing! The only thing I did differently was using frozen shrimp that I thawed and only using 1tbsp of the Dijon mustard because I was worried about the flavor of it. I didn't need to be though and next time I'll use the full amount. Oh, I also added a splash of white wine as others suggested. Served over angel hair pasta with asparagus spears. Thanks for the wonderful recipe!

Delicious as written. I decided to add some white wine, less mustard and more garlic. Instead of pouring the sauce over the shrimp I added the shrimp to the sauce and then poured everything into my 13 by 9 pan. When I don't serve over pasta I sprinkle panko breadcrumbs over them, seasoned with parm and Italian seasoning, salt and pepper.

My boyfriend and I LOVED this! It was one of those dishes where I had no idea how it was going to taste until I took a bite and I was so happy with it. This dish takes A LOT of butter though. Towards the end of my plate I kind of had a "okay I can't keep consuming this much butter" moment so I wouldn't make this dish too often but I will be making it again. Amazing.

This recipe was fabulous! My very sophisticated and discerning family members and guests all gave it 5 stars - a very difficult bar to achieve in this family. I did make the modifications suggested by Sydney on Dec 20, 2005 except that I used 4 lbs of shrimp and doubled the recipe. I have since shared the recipe with a friend, as modified, and her son can't stop raving about it. From Sydney: "I too made some modifications to this great recipe. I used 24 oz. of frozen shrimp, with the tail on. Used only 1 tablespoon of mustard, and I added apprx. 1 tablespoon old bay seasoning, 3 cloves of chopped garlic and 2 tablespoons of fresh parsley to the butter mix. After placing in a non stick cookie pan (with sides), I sprinkled it with a mixture (about two handfulls)of panko bread crumbs and fresh grated parmigiano-reggiano cheese. The last two to three minutes of cooking, I placed the oven on broil (just long enough to brown the tops of the shrimp). OUTSTANDING!"

I used a little Old Bay Seasoning on the shrimp, sprinkled fresh grated Parmesan onto the shrimp and baked for 8 minutes. (I used fresh Alaskan jumbo pink shrimp). After baking, I removed it, added Panko crumbs to the top with just another very light sprinkling of fresh grated Parmesan, put it under the broiler for 2 minutes make a nicely browned top. Such a delicious recipe. I used 3/4 cup butter since the shrimp were jumbo and it was perfect.
Followed the recipe. I've made it multiple times. The entire family loves it
Delicious and oh sooo easy! I will cut down on the amount of butter next time and I only used 1 tablespoon of the mustard. My husband LOVED it. Served it with a nice fresh salad and pasta.
The flavors in this are fantastic. Even hubby, who doesn’t really like shrimp ate every bite!
Great, The only changed I made was doubling the garlic. I served it over pasta.
Very good. Next time I will thicken the sauce, as I served it over fettuccine.
This recipe is quick, simple ingredients, and has great flavor. I can't wait to make it again.
My family loves it. Very easy to make
This was pretty good but I'll reduce the cooking time next time starting with 7 minutes and maybe add a bit more lemon.
This is a great recipe. Since there are only 2 of us, I made half a batch using 1 pound of frozen (defrosted) shrimp. It turned out better than I’d expected.

Made this for a quick Saturday night dinner. Wow. Hubs hates mustard so I cut the Dijon in half but we love garlic so I doubled that. Its hot in July in Texas, so I served with a Greek salad and garlic bread. Yum. So easy so good. Thanks for a great recipe that will be used often
DELICIOUS!!
This came out great. Thanks for the recipe!
Totally Epic, peeps ecstatic about flavors

By far The best shrimp scampi recipe I have ever made. Made it exactly as a recipe called and then I put some angel hair pasta in with it to soak up the sauce and it was phenomenal. It will definitely be a staple in our house from now on. Easy and delicious what more could you ask for?
Oh my goodness this is so good!!

This was THE most delicious scampi I have EVER had! I made the recipe exactly as listed, no changes. I did not use store-prepared items - chop the garlic, squeeze a real lemon & chop real parsley - it makes a difference! Nothing overpowered. 
 Sooo good. I can't wait to try it with chicken!

I used 1/2 the butter and left out the lemon juice since I’m not a fan of lemon. Sometimes leaving out the lemon juice makes it bland so I added a little red pepper flakes because I like some spice. I then put shrimp in a small casserole and some cod in another small casserole. Put 1/2 of the sauce over each and baked. it was so yummy! I’ve been looking for some fish recipes. I wasn’t sure if this would work but it was really good. Can’t bake them together because the cod takes so much longer. Then served over zoodles with a piece of cod and a few shrimp. Everyone loved it.

Only changes I made was a reduction in the amount of butter from 1 cup to 3/4 cup and added about 1/4 cup dry white wine as others suggested. There was plenty of sauce and the Dijon mustard gave the dish a nice, subtle 'zing'. Hubby loved it and we've eaten it for two meals and still have a few shrimp left over. It warmed up nicely in the oven. I put it in when oven was starting to warm up and left it in for a few minutes after it reached 400 degrees. It was plenty warm and still not overcooked. First time we had it I served it on a bed of wild rice and that was good...but the second time, I served it mixed with angel hair pasta and it was excellent! It is a nice, easy way to make shrimp scampi!! Thanks!!
This recipe is definitely a keeper! It was a very easy and delicious meal to prepare.
